message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CY 

This paper discusses the computational treatment of opinions and sentiments in text, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also discusses various machine learning techniques used in sentiment analysis, which falls under the category of artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (LG). Therefore, cs.AI and cs.LG are also likely sub-categories. The paper also discusses the use of data mining techniques to extract opinions from text, which falls under the category of information retrieval (IR). Therefore, cs.IR is another likely sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the use of cognitive psychology to analyze sentiments, which falls under the category of cybernetics (CY). Therefore, cs.CY is also a likely sub-category.
